column4: question about partitions. there was a 47mb fat 16 and a 55gb ntfs... i added the swap and then i couldnt add any more primarys. i added an extended and put a logical 10gb ext3 for ubuntu install and another 40gb fat32 for common files. is that right?
is that right? im scared to death to hit enter

It should work anyway.  "Right" is relative, depending on your needs.  I don't actually know if it matters, but I like to have my / on a primary partition, so if I were to do it, I'd switch the swap and root install.
make the 10GB primary and put swap and fat32 in extended?
Yeah.
ok, will it allow me to specify mount points later? i dont see them options yet
They should be there now, but even if they're not, the only mount point you _need_ to specify now is /, everything else can be edited later, although it's easier now and should be there.
no, no place to specify mount points
All right, let's try to find them.  Hopefully I remember these screens.  What do you see now?
Maybe it does need to apply them before setting that.  Would make sense I suppose.  We'll see.
ok, now it goes ther
Now it gives you the mount point option you mean?
my windows partition is called /media/sda2 is that ok?
Sweet deal.  And yes, you can have it as whatever you want, theoretically.
i appreciate your time tonight... my fat32 is not showing up in this emn. its the only one that isnt is thatok?
It's not showing in the list at all?
It might be worth backing up a step and trying adding it again, just for kicks, but it's not the complete end of the world otherwise, just addtional hassle.
Do you know what that other one was anyway?  Seemed odd to have such a small partition.
Would you have proper backups for the Windows stuff if you totally fried it?  (Not saying you're doing so, just checking)
i do have all my data backed up
There you go, then you won't be in trouble :)

what i wanna try... when this all working i wanna put vmware on the ubuntu install and create a virtual machine that uses the windows partition. then i can fire it up whenever i need to do anuything in windows and suspend it when i dont need it.
That's a sweet idea, but as soon as you get into that you'll have to find someone else for help ;)
thanks for all your help. windows and ubuntu both work. I  have a long way to go to get ubuntu working well.... but the repartition and install worked. thanks again for all your help... gnight
